snippet: The measure, long sought by President Rafael Correa, would impose fines for coverage deemed by regulators as unfair.
abstract: Ecuadorean Legislature passes law regulating news media, which Pres Rafael Correa says will force news organizations to act fairly but which opponents say will quash freedom of expression.

byline.original: By WILLIAM NEUMAN and MAGGY AYALA
byline.contributor: William Neuman reported from New York, and Maggy Ayala from Quito, Ecuador.

lead_paragraph: The measure, long sought by President Rafael Correa, would impose fines for coverage deemed by regulators as unfair.

headline.main: Ecuador Legislature Approves Curbs on News Media
headline.print_headline: Ecuador Law Places Limits On Reporters
